UI_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion, indicating that the closure was a result of government pressure1. The center announced that it was shutting down operations because of "unpreventable circumstances" and "forces beyond our control," further emphasizing the role of external pressures in its closure5. This event occurred in May 2023, when the center, which had been a safe space for the LGBTQ community in Beijing, was forced to close as part of a broader government crackdown on LGBTQ advocacy groups2.
traffic_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion, indicating that the closure was a result of government pressure [[1]]. The center announced that it was shutting down operations because of "unpreventable circumstances" and "forces beyond our control," further emphasizing the role of external pressures in its closure [[5]]. This event occurred in May 2023, when the center, which had been a safe space for the LGBTQ community in Beijing, was forced to close as part of a broader government crackdown on LGBTQ advocacy groups [[2]].
